titlepage.titleproper: Inventory of the Grayson Neikirk Kefauver papers
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 2012 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, memoranda, speeches and writings, minutes, and printed matter, relating to international educational reconstruction after World War II, and the organization of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Grayson Neikirk Kefauver papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1947.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note

chronitem.event: Member of National Survey of Secondary Education, conducted by U.S. Office of Education
Dean of School of Education, Stanford University
Founder and chair, Liaison Committee on International Education, Washington, D.C.
Participated in International Education Assembly (IEA), Harpers Ferry, West Virginia
American liaison to the Conference of Allied Ministers of Education (CAME), London
Member of U.S. delegation at the Conference for the Establishment of the United Nations Educational and Cultural Organization, London

bioghist.p: Source: "Grayson Neikirk Kefauver." Dictionary of American Biography. New York: Charles Scribner's Sons, 1974. Gale Biography In Context. Web. 19 Oct. 2012.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The papers relate to international educational reconstruction after World War II, and the organization of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization Correspondence. The papers consist of reports, memoranda, speeches and writings, minutes, and printed matter.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Education.
International education.
Reconstruction (1939-1951)
controlaccess.corpname: United Nations Preparatory Educational, Scientific and Cultural Commission.
